structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

text.section: The director of safety may, in case of need, appoint special policemen to do special duty at any place within the city, on terms he deems proper and not in conflict with the civil service provisions.

These special policemen shall be governed by such rules as the director may provide, and be given such powers as the director allows; if rules are not provided they shall have the powers and duties of regular policemen.

law.history: Amended 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 56, sec. 14, effective June 19, 1952. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 2870, 2878.
